item.description:
"In the land of hyphenated identity, Susan Poulin sets out on the sometimes humorous, sometimes treacherous path to reconnect with her Franco-American heritage. Her rollercoaster ride of self-discovery leads her to some surprising places. From the origins of Franco-American Spaghetti to the textile mills of Skowhegan, from logging camps on the Canadian border to being hypnotized to find the French in her head, Susan is determined to reclaim her first language and in the process reclaims a whole lot more. She's doing the assimilation samba and it's not as easy as it looks. The play is performed in English with some French references." -- From the UNH--Manchester website

Allons-y à voir ce spectacle sur la culture franco-canadien chez nous. On pourra se rencontrer soit à Portsmouth, soit à Manchester ... précisez vos préférences dans vos Comments, s.v.p.

**The play is in the 3rd floor auditorium and is scheduled for 6:30-8:30 pm.**

NB: A few of us will meet at 5 pm at Strange Brew Tavern (www.strangebrewtavern.net) for dinner and a bonne bière.
item.how_to_find_us: Let's try to carpool over ... meeting place TBA.

group.name: Seacoast NH French Language Meetup Group

item.name: Pardon My French! - a play with music by Susan Poulin & Gordon Carlisle
